Sentencas: Mixed conducting strontium doped samarium cobaltite perovskites as cathodes in solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) have received much attention due to their low polarization at low operating temperature.
Titulo: Characterization of the microstructure and electrochemical behavior of Sm0.7Sr0.3Co3-δ cathode deposited by solution precursor plasma spraying

Sentencas: On the other hand, thermal spraying is considered to be a promising cost-effective processing method because of its fast deposition feature compared with other film formation processes.
Titulo: Characterization of the microstructure and electrochemical behavior of Sm0.7Sr0.3Co3-δ cathode deposited by solution precursor plasma spraying

Sentencas: Moreover, the functional layers in nanometer and sub-micrometer size grains can be easily deposited by solution precursor plasma spraying (SPPS).
Titulo: Characterization of the microstructure and electrochemical behavior of Sm0.7Sr0.3Co3-δ cathode deposited by solution precursor plasma spraying

Sentencas: In this work, strontium doped samarium cobaltite (Sm0.7Sr0.3CoO3-delta, SSC) cathodes were deposited by SPPS to aim to reducing the polarization.
Titulo: Characterization of the microstructure and electrochemical behavior of Sm0.7Sr0.3Co3-δ cathode deposited by solution precursor plasma spraying

Sentencas: The deposit phase structure was characterized by x-ray diffraction, and the surface morphology was examined by scanning electron microscopy.
Titulo: Characterization of the microstructure and electrochemical behavior of Sm0.7Sr0.3Co3-δ cathode deposited by solution precursor plasma spraying

Sentencas: The electrochemical behavior of SPPS-sprayed SSC cathodes was investigated through the impedance spectroscopy.
Titulo: Characterization of the microstructure and electrochemical behavior of Sm0.7Sr0.3Co3-δ cathode deposited by solution precursor plasma spraying

Sentencas: The effect of spray distance on the polarization was discussed.
Titulo: Characterization of the microstructure and electrochemical behavior of Sm0.7Sr0.3Co3-δ cathode deposited by solution precursor plasma spraying
